summary: This bill, the "Ending Drug Trafficking in Our Communities Act," aims to reauthorize and modify the High Intensity Drug Trafficking Areas (HIDTA) Program. It amends the Office of National Drug Control Policy Reauthorization Act of 1998 by providing $400 million annually for the HIDTA program from 2026 to 2031. It also mandates the Director to review promising practices within HIDTAs, develop these practices for broader use, and then disseminate them to each HIDTA. The focus is on enhancing efficiency and effectiveness, particularly related to identifying trafficking entities, information sharing, and evidence-based prevention programs.
